utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, so we went to the beach, because Phoebe found out about this lady who knew her mom and dad, and I don’t really know what happened with that.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: I’m your mother.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ehh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, and then Monica joked that she wouldn’t go out with a guy like Chandler...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi there.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: ...and he couldn’t let it go, and... I don’t really know what happened with that either.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh-oh! And then Ross’s new girlfriend, Bonnie, shows up and Rachel convinced her to save her head. And then Ross and Rachel kiss, and now Ross has to choose between Rachel and the bald girl and I don’t know what happened there either...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y'know what, hold on, let me go get Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Bonnie
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: Rachel was just helping me out. My head got all sunburned.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Awww.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: Thanks a million.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you’re welcome a million.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll see you in our room.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whoa! What?! Why?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I-I gotta go break up with Bonnie.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Here?! Now?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, yeah. I can’t-I can’t stay here all night, and if I go in there she’s-she’s gonna wanna... do stuff.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, can’t you tell her that you are not in the mood?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, she likes that. Yeah. Faking sleep doesn’t work either, I can’t tell you how many mornings I woke up with her...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whoa-ho.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whoa-oh, okay! Yeah, why am I telling you that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. It wasn’t every morning.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, making it worse!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: So I guess you’d like to know how it all happened.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I-I mean I, well I think I can figure it out. I guess y'know I was born, and everyone started lying their asses off!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: Noo! No! It wasn’t like that I... Remember how I told you how Lily, Frank, and I we were, we were close. Well, we were, we were very close.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How close?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: Well, the-the three of us we were, kind of umm, a couple.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t even know how that would work!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: Well, we were...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m not asking!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: Well, any how, some how I got pregnant, and, and I was scared. I was stupid and sellfish, and I was 18 years old. I mean, you remember what it’s like to be eighteen years old?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Let’s see, my had Mom killed herself, and my Dad had run off, and I was living in a Gremlin with a guy named Cindy who talked to his hand.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: Well, I’m so sorry. I thought I was leaving you with the best parents in the world, I didn’t even hear about your Mom and Dad til a couple of years ago, and by then you were already grown up. I don’t know, you’re here, and I would, I would really, I would like to get to know you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, well, everybody does! I’m a really cool person. And y'know you had 29 years to find that out, but you didn’t even try! Y'know what, you walked out on me, and I’m just, I’m gonna do the same thing to you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: Wait!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t ever want to see you again!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, where’s my purse?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Shoot! We’re out of soda.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I’ll go out and get you some.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nope! Because I’m not your boyfriend. Hey Pheebs, how did it go?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, umm, my Mom’s friend, Phoebe, is actually my birth Mom.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I found a dried up seashores.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sweety, what are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, my new Mom, who-who’s a big, fat abandoner!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa, wait, Pheebs, wait a second! Don’t you wanna stay here and talk about it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. I’m just, I wanna, I need to be alone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Monica!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s over.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, was it awful?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, it was loong. I didn’t even realise how late it was, until I noticed the 5 o’clock shadow on her head. Anyway, she didn’t want to stay. I called a cab; she just left.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I wrote you a letter.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ohh! Thank you! I like mail.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s just some things I’ve been thinking about. Some things about us, and before we can even think about the two of us getting back together, I just need to know how you feel about this stuff.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. Wow, it’s-it’s 5:30 in the morning. So, I’d better get cracking on this baby.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I’ll be waiting for you, just come up when you’re done.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll be up in, 18 pages. Front and back. Very exciting.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh. Oh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! What happened to you? Why didn’t you come up?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Done!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You just finished?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I wanted to be thorough. I mean this-this is clearly very, very important to you, to us! And so I wanted to read every word carefully, twice!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So umm, does it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Does it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Does it? Does it? Yeah, I wanted to give that whole ‘Does it?’ part just another glance.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What are you talking about, Ross, you just said that you read it twice! Look, y'know what, either it does or it doesn’t, and if you have to even think about it...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, Rach, no. I don’t, I don’t, I don’t have to think about it, in fact, I’ve decided, I’ve decided that, that it.......does.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, sure! I’m sure.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, there’s a nuclear holocaust, I’m the last man on Earth. Would you go out with me?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ennnh.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’ve got canned goods.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, you guys! Take a look at this! Check this baby out, dug me a hole!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Excellent hole, Joe.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh no! No!! My hole!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ow!! Ow!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?! What?!! What is it?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Jellyfish sting! Oh, it hurts! It hurts!! It hurts!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, can we help?! You want us to take you back to the house?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s like two miles!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, and I’m a little tired from digging the hole.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh damn the jellyfish. Damn all the jellyfish!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We’ve got to do something!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, there’s really only one thing you can do.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! What is it?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You’re gonna have to pee on it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!! Gross!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Don’t blame me, I saw it on The Discovery Channel.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know what, he’s right. There’s something like uh, ammonia in that, that like kills the pain.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well forget it! It doesn’t hurt that baaad!!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: If you want some privacy you can use my hole.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I’m ready to get the hell out of here! Oh. Are you? Are you?!! Ohh! That’s so great!! Ooh, not for Bonnie. But for you, yay! Ohh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How was the beach?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nothing, I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nothing. I’m gonna take a shower.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Me too!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I’m gonna put this in the car.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, I have to go pack. It really does?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It does. It really and truly does.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It so does not!!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She wants me to take responsibility for everything that went wrong in our relationship. I mean she goes on for five pages about, about how I was unfaithful to her! WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God! If you say that one more time, I’m gonna break up with you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fine! Fine! But this break-up was not all my fault, and she, she says here, “If you accept full responsibility...” Full responsibility! “...I can begin to trust you again. Does that seem like something you can do. Does it?!!”

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, Ross, you have what you want, you’re back with Rachel. If you bring this up now you’re gonna wreck the best thing that even happened to you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. I mean, no, you’re right. Yeah I guess I’ll let it go. But you-you understand how-how hard it is to forget about this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure, it’s hard to forget! But that doesn’t mean you have to talk about it! A lot of things happened on that trip that we should never, ever talk about.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What the hell happened on that beach?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s between us and the sea, Ross!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi, Ursula.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, well umm, I know that we haven’t talked in a long time, but umm okay, our Mom is not our birth Mom. This-this other lady is our birth Mom.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Right, okay, the one that lives in Montuak, umm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You know her?!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: No, I umm, I read about her in Mom’s suicide note.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: There-there was a suicide note?! Well, do you still have it?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Hang on.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can’t believe you didn’t tell me there was a suicide note!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yeah. So how have you been doing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I, umm, shut up!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: “Good-bye Phoebe and Ursula. I’ll miss you. P.S. Your Mom lives in Montauk.” You just wrote this!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Well, it’s pretty much the gist. Well, except for the poem. You read the poem, right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Noooo!!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: All right, hang on!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Pass the cheese, please.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: My God, you can’t even look at me! Can you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! Phoebe! We can talk to Phoebe!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. I’m-I’m to depressed to talk.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’ll give you a thousand dollars to talk to us.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, you guys! What do you, what do you think about making that beach trip an annual thing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, that’s it, you guys! What happened out there?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What? We took a walk, nothing happened. I can back with nothing all over me.

utterance.speaker: Ross and Rachel
utterance.content: Come on!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What happened? Joey?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! Joey, we swore we’d never tell!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: They’ll never understand!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, we have to say something! We have to get it out! It’s eating me alive!! Monica got stung by a jellyfish.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right!! All right. I got stung. Stung bad. I couldn’t stand. I-I couldn’t walk.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We were two miles from the house. Scared and alone. We didn’t think we could make it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I was in too much pain.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And I was tired from digging the huge hole!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And then Joey remembered something.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’d seen this thing on The Discovery Channel...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait a minute! I saw that! On The Discovery Channel, yeah! About jellyfish and how if you... Ewwww!! You peed on yourself?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
utterance.content: Ewwww!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You can’t say that!! You-you don’t know!! I mean I thought I was gonna pass out from the pain! Anyway I-I tried, but I-I couldn’t...bend that way. So...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s right I stepped up! She’s my friend and she needed help! And if I had too, I’d pee on anyone of you! Only, uhh, I couldn’t. I got the stage fright. I wanted to help, but there was too much pressure. So-so I uh, I turned to Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey kept screaming at me, “Do it now! Do it!! Do it! Do it now!!” Sometimes late at night I can still here the screaming.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s ‘cause sometimes I just do it through my wall to freak you out.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: “...fuchsia and mauvvve. Those are the 66 colours of my bedroommmm.” Thank you, thank you. Ohh, and I invite you to count the colours in your bedroom. Except for you. You go away.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: I’ll go in a second, I-I just wanted to tell you that there hasn’t been a day where I didn’t regret giving you up.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, bye.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: No, I’m not done. I-I-I just want you to know that I, the reason I didn’t look you up was, well I was afraid that you’d react, just well like, the way, the way you’re reacting right now, and can’t we just, y'know, start from here?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: Sorry. But just one last thing. Y'know you came looking for family. I’m family, I’m it. Now, now I’m done.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But, it’s not like we’re losing anything. Y'know?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess you’re right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s not like we-we know each other or anything. Or that have anything in common.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know. I mean it’s not like we don’t have anything in common. I mean I like uh, pizza.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I-I like pizza!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: You do?! Wait, I like umm, the Beetles.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God, so do I!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: I knew it, wow!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait-wait-wait, wait! Puppies. Cute or ugly?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: Ohh, so cute.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh, well! But umm, still I’m-I’m mad at you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: I know. I’m mad at me too.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well umm, do you wanna get something to eat? I’m kinda hungry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr.
utterance.content: Hey! Me too!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, stop it. Now you’re just doing it to freak me out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh-hooo, I missed you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I missed you too.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, I was soo nervous about that letter. But the way you owned up to everything, it just showed me how much you’ve grown. Y'know?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I suppose.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You have! Ross, you should give yourself credit. I mean my Mom never thought this would work out. It was all, “Once a cheater, always a cheater.”

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Umm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, I just wish we hadn’t lost those four months, but if time was what you needed just to gain a little perspective...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Coffee house?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You bet.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And for the record, it took two people to break up this relationship!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! You and that girl from that copy place, which yesterday you took full responsibility for!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I didn’t know what I was taking full responsibility for! Okay?! I didn’t finish the whole letter!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I fell asleep!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You fell asleep?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It was 5:30 in the morning, and you had rambled on for 18 pages. Front and back!! Oh-oh-oh, and by the way, Y-O-U-apostrophe-R-E means ‘you are,’ Y-O-U-R means ‘your!’

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y'know I can’t believe I even thought about getting back together again! We are so over!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: FINE BY ME!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, oh, and hey-hey-hey, those little spelling tips will come in handy when you’re at home on Saturday nights playing Scrabble with Monica!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sorry!! I just feel bad about all that sleep you’re gonna miss wishing you were with me!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, no-no-no don’t you worry about me falling asleep. I still have your letter!!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And hey! Just so you know, it’s not that common! It doesn’t happen to every guy! And it is a big deal!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I KNEW IT!!!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Gin.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We were playing Gin? Y'know if we were a couple, we could play this game naked.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Will you stop!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. All right.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, all right, I think you’re great, I think you’re sweet, and you’re smart, and I love you. But you will always be the guy who peed on me.
